definition: to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: One of Schriever's colleagues observed that they had "introduced the president . . . to the nuclear missile age."
sentences.chinese: 施裏弗的一位同事稱，他們將總統帶進了核導彈時代。

sentences.english: Even their nuclear missiles were provided by the Americans.
sentences.chinese: 甚至英國的核導彈也來自於美國。

sentences.english: Negotiations between the U. S. and the Soviet Union aimed at curtailing the manufacture of strategic nuclear missiles.
sentences.chinese: 美國與蘇聯間爲了削減生產戰略核導彈的談判。

sentences.english: US spots Soviet nuclear missiles in Cuba.
sentences.chinese: 美國發現蘇聯把核導彈部署於古巴。

sentences.english: Nuclear missiles are, after all, worst-case weapons, doomsday bombs.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，核導彈是最壞情況下使用的武器，末日炸彈。

sentences.english: One of them being Super Charged Particle Beams, and the other being Tiberium Core Missiles.
sentences.chinese: 其中之一就是超級充能粒子束，此外再就是泰核導彈。
